title: The fact a lot of theists believe people deserve to burn in hell (potentially for eternity) proves that religion has a negative impact emotionally on otherwise decent people.

author: BenWright861
text:
Your mother holds true to her God over you. That is how it should be. Your mother is right.

You think you are a good person but you don’t worship God who is good? You are not a good person. Your definition of good is what culture calls good. Go beyond your culture. To be good is to be self less. To be self less is to love God. Just focus on that and don’t worry about going to hell.

author: Andromeda-Native
text:
My mother doesn't know this god actually exists but she knows for a fact i exist. Thats the big difference here.

To be extra, she also knows I'm not a bad person, the only difference between our lifestyles is she worships God and i do not.
So its baffling she thinks I deserve hell.

Religion did this to my mother!

author: RadiKillation
text:
>My mother doesn't know this god actually exists but she knows for a fact I exist.

I think its fair to say most Muslims wouldn't pray 5 times a day and only eat halal food and abstain from sin if they didn't consider God to actually exist.

​

>To be extra, she also knows I'm not a bad person, the only difference between our lifestyles is she worships God and I do not.

Who decides what makes a good or bad person? Who decided your mother was good and you are bad? However, from an Islamic perspective you could be identical in all action but belief in God and your mother would be a better person because of it.

Why? Because God, and in the case of Islamic understanding, the all powerful and all knowing, literally said so.

​

>So its baffling she thinks I deserve hell.

Its not really. If she is a Muslim and believes in the Quran as the revelation of God then its not hard to infer that if one disobeys God then he or she is deserving of Hellfire because again God said so.

author: BenWright861
text:
She knows God exists because if she didn’t she wouldn’t love Him. How can you love something you’re not sure exists? You can’t.

God exists like good exists.

She does not think you are good because only God is good. And only through God can man be good.

And only God knows the heart of man.

author: -TheExtraMile-
text:
> You are not a good person.

Go fuck yourself.

author: pml2090
text: Is the atheist ego seriously that fragile?  They can't even for a second entertain the possibility that they may not be "good" by some metric?  What a sorry state for a person to be in.

author: -TheExtraMile-
text: Is the theist ego so bloated that they dare to judge another human being simply because they don’t share the same addiction to that artificial comfort they find in millenia old fairytales? What a hateful and elitist state for a human to be in.

author: pml2090
text:
I don't hate you at all!  If anything, I'm guessing it's the other way around.

I don't know you, but I know me...and I have reason to suspect you are just like me...if that's true, then neither of us are good, according to the scale that I'm using.  If we use what we might call a secular scale of goodness, chances are we're both pretty good people...although it seems to me you might struggle with anger problems, but that's not uncommon.

author: -TheExtraMile-
text:
How about this, you use your scale on yourself and nobody else. Assume that you have no right to judge others based on what fairytales they do or do not believe in. How about you don’t arrogantly tell strangers that they are not good people?

If religious people would only focus on themselves instead of judging others, then we would have made quite a bit of progress.

author: pml2090
text: Sure, I would never force you to use my scale...I'm not even sure how I would go about doing that even if I wanted to.  But no matter what scale I use, I won't be able to stop myself from forming an opinion of you.  And my opinion is that you're like me.  Sorry not sorry, as the kids say.

author: -TheExtraMile-
text:
Now isn’t that a very simplistic way of looking at things?

You are like me, therefore you have to obey the same childlike delusions that I suffer from.

How about judging people by their individual actions. There are good and bad people among every religion and atheists. It’s only logical to not assume any bias either way.

But you do you.

author: pml2090
text: My man, you are full send right now.  Relax.  Read my last comment.  I said: "I would never force you to use my scale".  You don't have to obey anything that I say, especially something you consider to be a childlike delusion.  I'm simply sharing my opinion.  That's the point of this sub.

author: -TheExtraMile-
text: As am I. Have a good one!
